commit.title: Adding a new constructor to utilise non-twitter gnip endpoints
Use the new Travis CI container infrastructure
client.shutdown should be client.close in README
Update Twitter4JClient interface to be public
update README to reflect latest maven version number 2.2.0
AbstractEnterpriseStreamingEndpoint with Realtime and Replay concrete implementations. Add test for multi-product support on endpoints. Added new test class for LineStringProcessor.
add support for all enterprise products
Add support for replay enterprise API and associated endpoint test

Fix RestartableHttpClient.It kills its connectionmanager when it restarts, so we have to create a new one. So don't allow passing in a single instance of connectionmanager; it won't work. Instead, create a new one with the given schemeregistry, which can now be provided - this is the main thing to customize in a connectionmanager anyways

Fixed user and message extraction from Sitestream message envelopes. There are several types of messages that are unwrapped: control stream, disconnect, warning, location, source, user_reconnected, etc.
Add support for follow parameter on GET site.
update maven release version for pom example; fix code example; fix typos
Allow hosts and client to be optional arguments to SitestreamController
Make sitestream hosts a default argument
Separate the SitestreamController from the Client. Updated example.
Move the default pooling connection manager declaration up to ClientBuilder
Add separate HttpClient for controlstream usage
add more guidance to the readme for running the example
use target_object instead of target for list events
expose new withUser method on UserstreamEndpoint
Updated addUser and removeUser so they do not proxy to addUsers, removeUsers in order to minimize merge issues.
Used more specific Longs.asList wrapper rather than Lists.newArrayList
Added tests for SitestreamController for the following methods: getInfo, addUser, addUsers, removeUser, removeUsers.
Added preconditions test to enforce maximum number of user_id values to 100 on addUser and removeUser as per docs at https://dev.twitter.com/docs/streaming-apis/streams/site/control#add
The addUser and removeUser now support multiple userIds rather than having to add one at a time. The param is passed as user_id=1234,4567,1234,4567 as per docs.
Deprecated existing getInfo call so as not to break code currently using this method (although it was broken so not likely that many use it)
Fix bug when we have multiple reads in DelimitedStreamReader
Fix locations support for filter streams
Call getConnectionManager().shutdown() only once when stopping
make this easier to play with
make it clear that you need to compile to run the examples
Use the proper Travis CI link for build status
Merge branch 'j7-take2' of github.com:twitter/hbc into j7-take2
Update Travis to run on OpenJDK7
Remove useless TODOs, fix up README
Add the ability to easily run the sample stream
